intro: Lysistemma dendigulense, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is known for its milky sap, which is toxic and serves as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Lysistemma dendigulense is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
